intro: Homalostoma, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their striking, often blue or purple, ray florets and cylindrical disk flowers. They are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Homalostoma species are perennial herbs that produce small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Their unique morphology and ecological niche make them valuable subjects in botanical studies.
